parameters.name: strp
parameters.description: A pointer to a location where the function can store a pointer to the allocated string.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
A string that specifies the format of the output.
  The formatting string determines what additional arguments you need to provide.
  For more information, see
  printf().

full_content:
Function: asprintf
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/asprintf.html
Synopsis: int asprintf( char **strp,
Headers: #include <stdio.h>
Parameters:
  - strp: A pointer to a location where the function can store a pointer to the allocated string.
  - format: A string that specifies the format of the output.
  The formatting string determines what additional arguments you need to provide.
  For more information, see
  printf().
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <stdio.h>

int asprintf( char **strp, 
              const char *format, 
              ... );
